dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So have you ever heard of something called a black hole?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: What is a black hole?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Well, it has to do with, a lot with gravity, do you know what gravity is?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: No, not at all.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It's what keeps us on the earth.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: The reason we're not just flying off the earth is because earth has gravity, so if we throw something up, it comes back down, so that's why when we're walking on the earth, we don't fly off the earth because the earth has gravity, and it keeps us down.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Nice.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: The main thing about black hole to remember is that it's just, like I said, how the earth holds you down, the black hole pulls you in, as well. Now, try and take the ball from me, black hole--

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Why do you hold it so tight?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: I'm holding it tight to show you then when you're trying to pull it, a black hole will really hold onto it with its gravity.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: I got it.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah. The main thing is that if something falls into a black hole, it can never get out, it's--

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: What about the earth? What if it rolls into it--

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Oh, if the earth rolls into it?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It would be bad, we wouldn't be able to get out.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: So it could never happen?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It's never, not likely to happen, no.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Only in movies, right?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Well, yeah, definitely in movies, yeah.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yeah, but it's not real because it's just pictures of it.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah, exactly.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: What if I went in there?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: The black hole will sort of stretch you out as you're falling in.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: It'll, like, stretch my body out?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So what do you think about black holes?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: It's kind of dangerous.
